channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Will Intel give up on chip manufacturing? Here’s how that could have big ripple effects.
item.description: Samsung and TSMC could benefit from the move, while makers of wafer fab equipment may lose out, according to Bernstein analysts.

item.title: Doosan Robotics acquires a majority stake of U.S.-based ONExia for $25.9M
item.description: Doosan said ONExia, as a U.S.-based provider, will help it expand globally, and will bring decades of data to bolster AI capabilities. The post Doosan...

item.title: How E2B became essential to 88% of Fortune 100 companies and raised $21 million
item.description: AI infrastructure startup E2B secures $21 million funding with 88% Fortune 100 adoption rate, powering secure AI agent deployments at scale.

item.title: ‘I keep getting the same song and dance’: My salary has not kept up with inflation. Is my company cheating me?
item.description: “If my salary had kept pace with inflation, I would be earning an additional $17,000 a year.”

item.title: The Download: how China’s universities approach AI, and the pitfalls of welfare algorithms
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Chinese univ...

item.title: Coinbase investors should cash in. The stock has rallied too much ahead of earnings, analyst says.
item.description: If you bought Coinbase’s stock two months ago when Monness Crespi Hardt analyst Gus Gala recommended it, you should take the profit now, he said.

item.title: Figma’s hot IPO may open the door for more big software deals
item.description: Figma may lead the way for other software companies including Genesys, Canva and Databricks to conduct multibillion-dollar deals, one analyst said.

item.title: U.S.-China tariff truce to keep going with more Trump trade deals on the horizon
item.description: In the wake of the Trump administration’s trade deal with the European Union, investors have turned to watching for other agreements ahead a deadline ...

item.title: Chinese universities want students to use more AI, not less

item.title: When progress doesn’t feel like home: Why many are hesitant to join the AI migration
item.description: What happens if the AI migration accelerates and sizable portions of the workforce are slow to move out of fear, resistance or inability?

item.title: Dusty Robotics adopts Hexagon’s Leica AT500 laser tracker
item.description: When paired with the Dusty FieldPrinter 2, the AT500 improves setup speed and usability while supporting Dusty’s 1/16″ accuracy standard for applicati...

item.title: Meta announces its Superintelligence Labs Chief Scientist: former OpenAI GPT-4 co-creator Shengjia Zhao

item.title: Swift Navigation raises $50M to bring centimeter-level positioning to robotics

item.title: MIT vision system teaches robots to understand their bodies
item.description: MIT CSAIL researchers said Neural Jacobian Fields can learn to control any robot from a single camera, without any other sensors. The post MIT vision ...

item.title: Why AI is making us lose our minds (and not in the way you’d think)
item.description: The question isn’t, “will you use AI?” The question is, “what kind of AI user do you want to be: driver or passenger?”

item.title: New AI architecture delivers 100x faster reasoning than LLMs with just 1,000 training examples
item.description: Hierarchical Reasoning Models (HRM) tackle complex reasoning tasks while being smaller, faster, and more data-efficient than large AI models.
